fr:ul.fr:li: The proof of image embedding is wrong.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \mathcal { C } be a category with images. Then for any object f \in { \mathcal { C } _{/ B }}, the underlying morphism of the unit \vartheta _{f} \colon f \to \mathsf { Img } (f) has the property that if \vartheta _{f} = mg and m is monic, then m is an isomorphism. Moreover, if \mathcal { C } has equalizers then \vartheta _{f} is an extremal epimorphism.
Let f \colon A \to B. Suppose that there are morphisms h \colon A \to C and g \colon C \rightarrowtail B such that \vartheta _{f} = gh.
Then by the universal property of adjunction, there is a unique s \colon A' \to C such that s \vartheta _{f} = h.
Then it follows that gs \vartheta _{f} = gh = \vartheta _{f}, but uniqueness implies that gs = \mathsf {id} _{ A' }. Thus, g is a monic split epimorphism, i.e., an isomorphism.

Now, suppose that \mathcal { C } has equalizers. It suffices to show that \vartheta _{f} is an epimorphism. Suppose that \gamma \vartheta _{f} = \gamma ' \vartheta _{f} then \vartheta _{f} factors through the equalizer of \gamma and \gamma '. Thus, the equalizer must be an isomorphism. Then it follows that \gamma = \gamma '.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Separated objects correspond to closed diagonal relations

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: An object A of a topos \mathcal { E } is separated iff the diagonal subobject \Delta \colon A \rightarrowtail A \times A is closed.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Every equivalence relation in a topos is effective
